4da8ba66027f3c8e-43.value:
*Evaluate for Pharmacologic ProphylaxisContraindications to initial
pharmacologic DVT prophylaxis   * Uncontrolled hemorrhage
 * Uncorrected coagulopathy (NR > 2 or platelets
   < 50,000)
 * Therapeutic anticoagulation
 * Intracranial hemorrhage/spinal hematoma
 * Neurosurgery in past 3 days
 * Removal or placement of epidural catheter
   within 2hrs
4da8ba66027f3c8e-43.valueAsHtml:
*Evaluate for Pharmacologic Prophylaxis
Contraindications to initial pharmacologic DVT prophylaxis 
  • Uncontrolled hemorrhage
  • Uncorrected coagulopathy (NR > 2 or platelets < 50,000)
  • Therapeutic anticoagulation
  • Intracranial hemorrhage/spinal hematoma
  • Neurosurgery in past 3 days
  • Removal or placement of epidural catheter within 2hrs

4da8ba66027f3c8e-44.value:
Standard Inpatient DVT ProphylaxisIPCS and either: rivaroxaban 10mg PO Q24H or
enoxaparin 30mg SubQ Q12H * Rivaroxaban preferred except for patients with:
 * Traumatic brain injury (TBI)Spinal cord injury (SCI)Grade 3-5 liver, kidney,
   and/or spleen injuries (without splenectomy)
 * If patient will be discharged on VTE prophylaxis
   (see flow sheet 4), write order for care management to begin discharge
   planning ASAP. Place written prescription in charge (include duration of VTE
   prophylaxis)
 * Chronic renal insufficiency  (CrCl Hemodialysis (HD) or acute renal failure
   (ARF): heparin 5000 units SubQ Q8HObesity  (wt > 120kg): enoxaparin 40mg SubQ
   Q12H (if patient also has ARF or requires HD then heparin 7500 units SubQ
   Q8hrs)Heparin allergy/history of heparin-induced thrombocytopenia:
   fondaparinux 2.5mg SubQ Q24H (contraindicated if CrCl Strict NPO or small
   bowel access only: do not use rivaroxaban
4da8ba66027f3c8e-44.valueAsHtml:
Standard Inpatient DVT Prophylaxis
IPCS and either: rivaroxaban 10mg PO Q24H or enoxaparin 30mg SubQ Q12H
  • Rivaroxaban preferred except for patients with:
    • Traumatic brain injury (TBI)
    • Spinal cord injury (SCI)
    • Grade 3-5 liver, kidney, and/or spleen injuries (without splenectomy) 
  • If patient will be discharged on VTE prophylaxis (see flow sheet 4), write order for care management to begin discharge planning ASAP. Place written prescription in charge (include duration of VTE prophylaxis)
  • Chronic renal insufficiency (CrCl <30mL/min): enoxaparin 30mg SubQ Q24H
  • Hemodialysis (HD) or acute renal failure (ARF): heparin 5000 units SubQ Q8H
  • Obesity (wt > 120kg): enoxaparin 40mg SubQ Q12H (if patient also has ARF or requires HD then heparin 7500 units SubQ Q8hrs)
  • Heparin allergy/history of heparin-induced thrombocytopenia: fondaparinux 2.5mg SubQ Q24H (contraindicated if CrCl <30mL/min) or rivaroxaban 10mg PO Q24H (contraindicated if CrCl< 30mL/min)
  • Strict NPO or small bowel access only: do not use rivaroxaban
